description: Calque of French déraciner, from racine (“root”), from Latin rādīx, rādīcis (“root”).

verbs.description: deracinate (third-person singular simple present deracinates, present participle deracinating, simple past and past participle deracinated)

entries.meaning: To pull up by the roots; to uproot; to extirpate.
To force (people) from their homeland to a new or foreign location.
(transitive, intransitive) To liberate or be liberated from a culture or its norms.
